intro: Consolida anthoroidea, commonly known as the common rocket or antirrhinum, is a flowering plant in the family Papaveraceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of bright orange or yellow flowers. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy to the touch. It blooms from late spring to early autumn and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. The seeds are small and contained within fluffy, three-lobed pods that release them when mature.
